metadata.title: CVE-2024-35786 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/nouveau: fix stale locked mutex in nouveau_gem_ioctl_pushbuf If VM_BINDis enabled on the client the legacy submission ioctl can't be used, howeverif a client tries to do so regardless it will return an error. In this casethe clients mutex remained unlocked leading to a deadlock insidenouveau_drm_postclose or any other nouveau ioctl call.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-35786` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
